Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state A, $P_A = 4 atm$ and $V = 1 L$
Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state C, $P_C = 1 atm$ and $V = 4 L$
According to the ideal gas equation of state $ rac{P_{A}V_{A}}{T_{A}}= rac{P_{C}V_{C}}{T_{C}}$, $T_{c}=T_{A}$ can be obtained

Therefore, from state A to state C is an isothermal change, the internal energy of the gas in the two states is unchanged, from the first law of thermodynamics, it can be seen that the gas absorbs heat and does work externally, and the external work is equal to the heat absorption, and the area of the P-V image is the external work, that is, the area surrounded by the red line, and $W=\frac{1}{2}\left(3+4\right)\times2\times10^{5}\times10^{-3}\mathrm{J}+\frac{1}{2}\left(3+1\right)\times1\times10^{5}\times10^{-3}\mathrm{J}$ can be obtained
